info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 6:16PM EDT until June 27 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast West Virginia, including the following county, Greenbrier.
* WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 612 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms has ended. However, minor flooding is occurring in the advisory area due to between 2 and locally 4 inches of rain that fell earlier this evening. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Fitzwater Branch, North Fork Cherry River, Panther Camp Creek, McMillion Creek, Dry Run, Elijah Branch, Big Clear Creek, Cold Knob Fork, Laurel Creek, Beech Run, Old Field Branch, Improvement Branch, Robbins Run and Little Laurel Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Leonard... Trout... Duo... - For flooding safety information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING
